comment.text: I want to start by saying our waitress was very pleasant and we didn't want long for our food to arrive. We'd been here a couple years ago but I don't remember the vibe or quality of their food. This time, we weren't satisfied with our food at all. I ordered the Nashville's hot chicken with the pimento cheese grits. I tried to eat it but once I bit into the chicken I was instantly turned off. The patty tasted like frozen chicken (which may be okay for some). My daughter ordered the oatmeal and she was not a fan. My partner ordered the chicken and waffles and the chicken was the same, lackluster. I wish I could rate this place higher, but it just wasn't giving me anything I needed.

Oh WOW, you will be sitting down to a great meal here!!!!  The biscuits are gigantic and delicious!  I had the scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese, again GREAT!  Very nice service as well. The drink was...interesting but good, I'm sure healthier than juice?   I'll be revisiting when I'm back in the area?

photos.caption: Maple-Cured Bacon Market Scramble Biscuit with Jam

comment.text:
We arrived at the restaurant, and the parking lot was fairly full, but we were able to locate an empty space up front.  On Sundays there are several lots open for overflow parking.  The host at the door was such a friendly and kind gentleman! 
 He set our expectations that it would be 60-90 minutes and that we have 5 minutes to arrive after they text our phone.  He also said it could be earlier, so be ready.  We waited about 45 minutes and sat at a shared table in the bar.  

The food was very good.  The biscuit was heavenly, and the hash browns were the most flavorful I've ever tasted.  

The only reason I didn't give 5 stars:  Our server was nice, but it started off weird as she looked at my daughter and asked around to find out who sat her there... it made us feel that she thought my daughter sat herself the way she was asking around "WHO sat them there".  But once she realized we were officially supposed to be there, she was nice and friendly.  The food came out quickly, and the presentation was nice.  

The mimosa was delicious also.

photos.caption: Scrambled eggs, delicious hash brown firtters and a huge Fluffy biscuit.

owner_replies.comment:
Hello Kelly,
Hello Kelly,

First i'd like to extend our apologies for the soured experience. Guest perception is everything and we could have done a much better job communicating with each other so that you were not left feeling uncomfortable. I'd love to invite you back for a much improved experience. For more details please email me: Julian@buttermilkkitchen.com

Thank you
Julian Guzman
General Manager

comment.text: The food was excellent and the service was above average. The service fee for the employees insurance fund was transparent at the onset of the meal.
Such a cute breakfast place! Great food and very nice people. We even received a complimentary birthday short stack!

I really want to love this place. Don't get me wrong- the food was good. But the service we received today was not up to par for what I've read from other reviews. Maybe it was an off day, but we felt forgotten. I watched two tables around us who were seated after us received drinks and appetizers while we waited for our waitress to acknowledge us. 

We eventually received water and placed our drink orders, as well as a cinnamon roll to start. 15-20 minutes passed and our waitress came up to our table and asked if we ordered a starter. We reminded her we did, and she eventually placed it in alongside our entrees. I ordered the hot chicken and grits, while my friend had pancakes and some sausage on the side. Our entrees came a few minutes after our cinnamon roll, so kudos to the kitchen for getting that done quickly. 

My friend asked for another side of syrup. And to no surprise... she never received it until she had to remind our waitress again.

Again, maybe it was an off day, but it was very off putting for us to constantly ask and remind our waitress what we ordered. I might come back, but I'm not in a rush to do so.

owner_replies.comment:
Hello Ana,

I sincerely apologize for the poor experience. It is our mission to serve guest local food and a smile. Could you share a little more details on your who served you? 

I can be reached at Julian@buttermilkkitchen.com 

Thank you 
Julian Guzman 
General Manager

comment.text: Always my go to breakfast spot! They have added and taken away from their menu. Their chicken is very good and the Milky Way cold brew and the flapjack the alcohol version made with whiskey top tier! The fried green tomatoes remain! Thank goodness, it's one of the best bites in the city! You will not be disappointed ordering those, to be safe order two!

I went back when they had a Yelp waitlist. I realize now that they require reservations which I do not like as much because it is hard to get a reservation unless you book weeks in advance.
The food was pretty good.

Omg this place is amazing. Get anything on the menu and it will not disappoint. Just go and try anything. I have been here several times and it is the best go to place in the Atl. I arrived back from a trip this morning and drove 25 miles out of the way just to eat here. It was so worth it.

As a side the biscuit is to die for. Huge and yummy!

photos.caption: Spicy Bloody Mary. So delish and very spicy.
Grit bowl with scrambled eggs, spinach.

comment.text:
The food was pretty good but the parking is a nightmare. The parking lots they have allocated is not enough for the size of the restaurant. I almost left because it was so hard to find a spot and there was also a wait to be seated. They  were very good about trying to accommodate everyone who did not have a reservation, I went to during a weekday at around 11am. 
I got the sweet tea fried chicken biscuit and scrambled eggs.

My son and I were going to go to another place for breakfast but this was closer to our morning destination. So glad we made this choice. We were seated quickly and the turnaround from the time we ordered to getting our food was amazingly fast especially given how busy they were.  The food was phenomenal. 
Pimento cheese grits is now my thing. The best surprise was my mug of tea. The tea was good, but the mug was great. The mug wall was thick and my tea was kept at the right temperature, but the outside didn't burn my hand. Also the mug was slightly textured.

photos.caption: This mug was amazing. It is thick walled and kept my tea hot, but the outside was just perfect to hold. It also had a slight texture.

comment.text:
Linsey is the greatest server hands-down. My family and I just moved from California and the hostility in Georgia is stellar, I love being here. 

The food is stupendous; I had the biscuits n gravy, wonderful. And, my children totally enjoyed the service and food. 

Buttermilk is a must, if you're in the area.

This place is known for their amazing biscuits and they do not disappoint!

It's a little small so there can be a wait but it moves pretty quickly. There's some parking around that may be confusing but there's signage to guide you. 

Once we were seated, we ordered pretty quickly and the food came out so fast. Everything tasted super fresh and tasty. Definitely get a biscuit if your dish doesn't come with one. I also got the Milky Way cold brew which was also rich and flavorful. I don't think you can go wrong with what you order!

The portions were HUGE! I mean even my cappuccino was king size, love it! The pimento cheese grits and chicken biscuit- YUM! Cinnamon rolls also good. Great service Necel (sp) and Brandon were great- basically started a sing along w the whole place
I would eat here every day if I could. Although it was PACKED, the staff was friendly and fast!

We are visiting Atlanta from out of town and found this gem while looking for breakfast. We did not make reservations and the wait was an hour for a table of 4. We got so lucky that we were seated in less than 10 minutes. The staff is pleasant and the food is delicious. It is worth the wait but make reservations if you don't want to wait long. I came with toddlers and they had everything the kids like to eat. The restaurant is super cute with great music.

Absolutely amazing! From the chai latte to the French toast w/added caramelized banana & scrambled eggs. My senses were delighted! Yum! And even moreso today, as I had leftover French toast. Tres magnifique!‍‍

photos.caption: Leftover French toast & caramalized banana. Forgot to take a pic of this delicious dish when dining with my friend

comment.text: Buttermilk, Buttermilk are you for real?! How can you be perfect in every way?! Ok folks...it's all that. Simply put. Chicken & waffle is insanely delicious. The chicken is crunchy/tender perfection. And just one buck more for the rye whiskey maple syrup upgrade is a super no-brainer on an awesome waffle. The Hot chicken & grits is equally delicious.  Plus ordering a side Biscuit w/jam is more amazingness. Add in a couple latte's and it's the perfect breakfast. Great atmosphere. Clean, upscale bathrooms. Super pleasant server and staff. 10 stars if I could!

It's not a secret how popular Buttermilk Kitchen is in the North Atlanta/Buckhead neighborhood.  Especially if you want to go on a weekend you better be ready to wait at least another.

Food wise this place is top notch.  The sides to go for are bacon, sausage, or any fruit.  Entrees include many great dishes.  I went with the chicken and waffles.  A hefty piece of fried chicken and a fresh pancake, I had plenty of food.

But a restaurant visit is not just food.  The parking situation is a nightmare.  A few spots in the front, along with about 20 more spots in the back and adjust lot.  Be careful if you resort to parking in the nearby grocery center parking lot as signs discourage it.  The wait time and system is draining.  There is not really anywhere to stand or sit and not be in the way. Despite that it's worth a trip, it just may not be your weekly brunch spot because of the waiting time.

Came here for brunch on Sunday with a reservation - seems to be a very popular spot, since the wait time was 2-3 hours long for walk-ins. Food is served very fast and waiters are polite.

Overall the meals are delicious with generous portions and good quality ingredients. Was not a fan of the grits (a a little lacking in flavor, but not salt, while the potatoes were a little too salty). The chicken and waffles are a must have! Chicken is a little dry but the waffles are perfect, crispy on the outside but soft). Butter is also house made, we loved! 

The feel of the restaurant is homely, like eating in someone's living room. Patio seating is spacey and heated + not loud.

Perhaps 4.25-4.5 stars...if I'm being precise...

After living in Atlanta for a while, had to see what all the fuss was about. 

A big disclaimer is that every time I've eaten here, I arrived before 9am, maybe even 8:30am. Even getting here this early, it's usually PACKED and there is a small wait time. If you don't get here early, it's gonna be a pain. Additionally, even getting here early doesn't entire spare you of the dicey parking situation. There's a couple small gravel lots behind the restaurant but they are SMALL. So yeah, if you drive a large truck or SUV, good luck. I really hope they are able to get better parking soon!!

Food wise, it's wonderful!!! Yes, they DO have the best biscuits. Massive, warm, FLUFFY, and their jams are to die for. You can really tell they're homemade. 
I they have a blueberry-basil jam (amazing, stunning, yummy) and with the chicken biscuit they serve a spicy red pepper jam, that pairs perfectly. 

I'm not a grit eater usually, but their pimento cheese grits are the bomb. The second time I went I ended up getting the grit bowl so Buttermilk Kitchen really converted me to the grit eating life! Additionally, if your a cold brew aficionado, theirs is divine! The portions are generous and I always leave feeling stuffed. Everything I've ever eaten here has been 10/10, and service is always solid. 

Buttermilk Kitchen is an amazing establishment, you just have to commit to getting up early and getting there! I would be thrilled if they were able to expand, they are so popular and it would make the dining experience even better!
Went here for Brinch on a Sunday, the customer service was amazing, the server had recommendations and told us how the food was prepared and never had to look for him!

It was not my first time trying buttermilk kitchen, but it is my first review. I haven't been in awhile and wanted to take my husband, as it was his first time going. I booked our reservation about 3 weeks in advance because every time we've wanted to go, the wait has been super long. The reservation was smooth and easy. Once we arrived, we were seated right away. However, the manager asked if we didn't mind moving tables and he would bring us an appetizer. That was easy enough, so we moved to another table and opted for the cinnamon roll. The cinnamon roll was so hot and melted in our mouths. We went ahead and placed our drink and food orders. For drinks, we ordered a drunken peach and a Milky Way cold brew. We both enjoyed our drinks. For entrees, we ordered the chicken biscuit with pimento grits and the standard, which came with 3 choices you could select from. The food was hot and fresh and it didn't take long to come out, despite the large crowd! Overall, buttermilk kitchen was really good and we looked forward to returning in the future.

photos.caption: Chicken Biscuit with a side of Pimento Grits
Milky Way Cold Brew with oat milk

comment.text: Looked for somewhere great to start the day and this place did not disappoint! It was packed and very busy. I had the pimento omlette and my bf had the chicken and waffles. The service was quick and the food serving was quite large. The food was very tasty, the biscuit was ok, I've had better. The pimento omelette was very good, it came with a blueberry compote which appeared to be made in house. The coffee was decent and had free refills. Be aware that this place has a 5% charge for benefits for employees.

This place was amazing! Great flavor from the cold brew and French press to the biscuits and omelette a and bacon! We made a reservation (for those who did not make a reservation had a two hour wait) and were seated immediately. The service was great and the server was very attentive. You could tell she was happy to be there. She was knowledgeable about the menu and pointed out the most popular selections on the menu to help is get started. The restaurant is a converted older house (probs from the very early 1900's) that had rooms sectioned off, but kept the space open with exposed original beams/framing. I loved it. The only thing is was really loud and exceptionally hard to hear the person talk right in front of us.  I still gave it a five stars because everything else was on point. I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Maple-Cured Bacon Local Sausage / Chicken Sausage Sauteed Kale Biscuit with Jam

comment.text: Loved the ambiance, food and service was awesome! Wa not my first time going and it won't be my last. If you are in ATL check them out!

photos.caption: Chicken Biscuit and Pimento Cheese Grits
Biscuits and Gravy w/ a side of Pork Sausages

comment.text:
I felt a little let down by my visit here. Based on the wait times and the positive reviews, I was expecting a lot more.

I found out about this place through and Instagram account I follow, and since I love breakfast food, I figured I'd give it a try. My partner and I went here a weekend prior to eating here but decided to go somewhere else because there was a 2 hour wait. We still wanted to try this place, so we made a reservation for the following weekend.

We ordered the fried green tomatoes, a pancake, shrimp and grits, and a chicken biscuit. None of the food we ordered was bad, but it also didn't really blow me away, with one exception. The pancake we had was perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. But ultimately I still didn't find any of it to be worth the cost. I've had just as good and even better brunch food in Atlanta for much cheaper.

Delicious food and nice service! Our waitress was very sweet. The place was pretty busy for a Saturday at brunch, but we made reservations and got seated quickly with our party of 7. The coffee was great and I ordered the chicken biscuit with a side of pimento grits. I didn't make any substitutions. The chicken biscuit was very good. Chicken was flavorful and breaded nicely. The biscuit was so good - crispy but soft on the inside with great seasoning. The grits were nice and cheesy. The atmosphere was humble but cozy. I enjoyed dining here and would come back if I ever come back to the area. Parking is limited FYI. I didn't get to take a pic of my meal before digging in - but it was great.

Overall, pretty decent brunch spot. Wait is a little long for the quality of food. Maybe somewhere I would go if the wait was less than 15 minutes, but just didn't feel like the wait was worth the food.

When we arrived the wait was about 45 minutes for Sunday brunch. We decided to stick it out. They do have a little area to order drinks while you wait. Their Bourbon Smash is pretty good. Once we were seated, we ordered:

Pickled green tomatoes: have a nice tartness to them that really does well with the breading. The crunch adds a nice texture difference to the tomatoes. Pretty good tasting dish overall.

Hot chicken and pimento cheese grits: grits were good and cooked well. The chicken breading was crunchy and okay. Unfortunately, the chicken was a little dry, which took away from the dish. Also, for me the chicken just seemed to be something that added to the grits, nothing really brought the dish together. Thinking back, I guess that makes sense since the dish is "hot chicken" and "grits." For me, wasn't a very exciting dish.

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Hiro,
 
Thank you for taking the time to join us at Buttermilk Kitchen. I apologize for the negative experience, there is no excuse for errors, but we would love the opportunity to try and rectify any previous shortcomings. If you have any questions, please contact me directly via email Julian@buttermilkkitchen.com
 
 
Julian Guzman
General Manager

comment.text: With over 2k reviews and 4.5 stars won me over. Upon arriving I quickly realized everyone knows of this spot. Parking is very limited and neighboring parking lots have signs up with "no parking from Buttermilk". This old building which was built in the 30's has sloping floors and an oldish feel to it. I had the fried chicken and waffles with whiskey rye syrup. Excellent! The coffee was strong and hot with constant refills. I would recommend trying  this place for breakfast if your in town for a few days.

This place has been on my brunch list since forever and I finally went !!  

It was nice but the wait time is so long. We waited almost an hour. Make sure to get on the waitlist online. 

NOW LET'S TALK ABOUT THE FOOD. 

Coffee was a big no. Their coffee looks so cool and nice but it doesn't really taste good. I don't recommend getting. 

Pimento Omelet - this was delicious but fair warning, the omelette is on the sweet side. The biscuit was amazing . As my side, I ordered the hash brown fritters that were good. OH the jelly WAS SO YUMMY. 

Grit Bowl - I'm not a grit person but I did try a little and it wasn't bad at all!  

Chicken Biscuit -  THIS IS IT  I think everyone's fav dish was this. The size was so big and the flavor was great. The biscuit was soft but a little crispy too. Like   

The Belt Sandwich - looked delicious but bread was too hard to enjoy it. Maybe ask them to not toast too long.

Enjoy ;) - IG: Travelfoodie_ishy

photos.caption: Milky Way Cold Brew Almond Joy Cold Brew
Belt sandwich with hash brown fritters

comment.text:
UMMM... YUM?!?! This this place was so good!

I was not expecting this place to be as good as it was. I was in town to see friends and they wanted to take us here. We got up early on a Sunday to make it there before the crowd and I wasn't sure what the hype was about until we got our food!

I got the Standard with: Eggs, Fried Chicken, and Hashbrown Fritters. It came with the most delicious biscuit too!! I think this meal was about $17 + a little extra for the chicken. A little pricey, but this food was seriously good. 

I also shared some Pimento Cheese Grits with my husband. It was mouthwatering. 

I love a good breakfast!!
The food was great service was great. Just a little over price for extra syrup $1.50 for less then 1oz.

Glad they take reservations now because the wait used to be forever! But the food is always amazing, it's a scratch kitchen of course. Gives southern vibes! Had a caramel latte and their special omelette with pimento grits and red pepper jelly.

photos.caption: Caramel latte made with almond milk

comment.text: So delicious. Nothing to complain about. The pimento grits added a great kick to the meal but the biscuits are very moist but holds together well. Chicken cooked perfectly. Would recommend.
Food, service and ambiance was great. Great little place I've driven past plenty of times and never stopped but will definitely be back.

I would be doing Buttermilk Kitchen a dis-service if I didn't upgrade my review to a 5, because it is more than deserved! It has easily become my favorite breakfast spot in all of Atlanta. The online waitlist has been a game changer and made coming here much easier. 

The service is consistently great. The coffee is consistently great, as far as breakfast restaurant coffee goes. It's never burnt and always tastes fresh. Very balanced flavor. 

The breakfast platter is my go to. Hearty portions. Not using hyperbole when I say this. The hashbrowns are the best I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned. Not oily. The jam/biscuit combo is top notch. The biscuit is so great. Solid grits and eggs. 

Thrilled Buttermilk Kitchen is in Atlanta. Request - please please please bring back the mushroom gravy!

Bonus - great spot if you have a peanut allergy

Don't get me wrong, the food was good. However, I think the hype around this place is a little overblown and you can get 99% as good food without having do wait over an hour and fight for parking (ended up parking down the street and walking over).

Fried Chicken (4/5): Good breading, chicken wasn't as moist as other places but wasn't dry at all. Sides complemented the chicken well.

Pimento Omelet (3/5): The omelet was forgettable. The fried green tomatoes were excellent and I could highly recommend getting an order of them.
Tyler was amazing and gave the best recommendations!  The kitchen was super fast!  Friendly and amazing service!  Will be back!

What a great place! I went here on my vacation, and this is probably the best food and service you will get anywhere! I got the French toast, with the maple bacon. It was so good, I asked for a side of whipped cream, and boy did that make a good breakfast! I was so pleased because the whole feel and ambiance off the place was so pretty and cozy. Our waitress was so respectful and sweet! She told us about all of her favorite dishes and their most popular ones too! I recommend this place for any occasion or day, it's so worth it!

The food here is the best you can get. The Mexican cola, cold brew coffee, and service were also pluses. This place is small and cozy but I highly recommend! I personally loved the biodegradable straws and to go boxes as well. I'll happily pay a premium to a business who supports their worker's benefits like this place. Get reservations in advance for Saturdays or Sundays! We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Nashville hot chicken & grits and fried chicken biscuit with Pimento Grits

comment.text: This place is an epic breakfast or brunch spot in Buckhead! The ambiance is cozy with a perfect southern feel. The biscuits and jam are amazing and the grits are the best I've had!

Food and service were great. We didn't have reservations but they were able sit us immediately on the patio for an hour which was plenty of time because the service was great and the food came out fast. We orders the chicken and waffles, hash bowl, chicken biscuit and hot chicken & pimento grits. Will definitely be back!!

Incredible brunch spot! The food was such great quality -- some of the best fried chicken and biscuits I have ever had! 
Service was swift and kind. Make sure you join the waitlist from home because there are long waits (for good reason). 
Fun little renovated home with a farmhouse theme makes this a great setting.

photos.caption: Fried chicken, grits, and homemade biscuit!

comment.text: The food was amazing! The best chicken biscuit I ever had! The service was great and the ambiance was so cute! I can't wait to go back! Definitely make a reservation!!!

This place is super hyped up, so I decided to give it a try. Sooo busy, but ended up getting seated in 30. Overall the food was good, but I didn't think it was worth the hype. Maybe I just had a mediocre batch of chicken.

My favorite breakfast spot. Food is really good and service is usually good and the servers have always been knowledgeable and super helpful in reference to recommendations. My only complaint is the host/hostess at the door. The overall process just seems disjointed. I've come and the guy particularly that works the door just isn't the right fit for that role. He can't remember names of parties and doesn't greet guest consistently. You go from 1 check in outside to inside and then you have to wait for the 2nd hostess to confirm where you should be seated. He also ask, if I have a preference for inside and outside but doesn't honor the request. On my most recent visit he asked, if I wanted to sit outside or wait longer for inside. I shared I would wait for inside seating and I was still sat outside. Overall food is really good.

This restaurant came highly recommended on all platforms including our AirBNB hosts, and I think that it certainly delivered to its expectations! 
We did have quite a wait, I do wish I knew that there is an option to join the waitlist online, if you are looking to visit I highly recommend this. We had an hour wait for a weekday morning, I'm sure the weekends are worse. The only downfall that I see here is there is only one working bathroom, we were on a road trip and leaving for another city that morning, the wait for the bathroom was also very long. 
The food made up for the long waits, we ordered the chicken biscuits, chicken and waffles and the French toast. It was very delicious. Service was quick and our waitress was very friendly. 
Please give this a chance if you're in the area, but remember to make a reservation!

Went to brunch and had the pancakes and some scramble eggs.  The pancakes were a slight disappointment.  Fluffy but taste like vanilla and dough; no other flavor.  The eggs were good.  The service was excellent and building was clean. Parking was a bit of a headache, but manageable.
Busy modern southern restaurant. Everything was excellent. Loved then biscuits and am excited to try the pancakes next time. However getting a table at this crowded restaurant is a challenge.
